questions.explanation: Natural numbers start from 1, so 0 is not considered a natural number.
Whole numbers (0, 1, 2, 3, ...) are a subset of integers.

question.text: Every rational number is also a real number.

questions.explanation: Rational numbers are part of the set of real numbers.
√3 is an irrational number because it cannot be expressed as a fraction of two integers.

question.text: Every integer is a whole number.

questions.explanation: Integers include negative numbers, which are not part of whole numbers.
Pi is a non-terminating, non-repeating decimal and cannot be written as a fraction.

question.text: The number 2 is the smallest prime number.

questions.explanation: 2 is the smallest and the only even prime number.
2 is a prime number and it is even.

question.text: A composite number has exactly two factors.

questions.explanation: Composite numbers have more than two factors.

question.text: Every natural number is a real number.

questions.explanation: Natural numbers are a subset of real numbers.
